After all these years, I would expect this chain to have fallen on hard times. No chance. It seems their formula will likely carry them to continued success. An unchanging menu and uniformly good preparation across the chain makes this purveyor of American fare a safe choice wherever one goes. You are not likely to find great innovation here as the secret to their success is doing what they've always one--but doing it very well indeed. It's a memory lane experience after having been away from a market where this chain operates to experience that consistency again. The chunk of broccoli cooked perfectly crisp-tender is a thing of beauty. (For me, anyway.) And a delightful wait staff as well. A model for other chains to emulate.

This was very disappointing ... and that was surprising. Yhis was our first time at this location. The fried calamari was marginal at best ... the batter was heavy and seemed "doughy". Then we had the chicken pot pies, a favorite of ours. This time the crust was dark on top but nearly raw underneath and the filling was overly thick. All in all not up to their usual standards. We have had these dishes at other locations and they were much, much better. Will probably not return to this location.

My partner and I visited Delfini Citta because of a Groupon offer - two alcoholic drinks and a pizza for $20 or something - on a Friday evening. We both ordered martinis, a pizza and two salads. The restaurant was relatively empty, so the atmosphere was quiet.

column13: The food here has really taken a turn for the worst. It use to be the best reuben I've ever had and now they've changed the recipe and the food really is not up to par. Other than that, the piano players are awesome as always and the crowd is very lively.

I noted the noise as "Moderate" only bc there was a wedding going on. I will be recommending Descanso Beach Cabana dinner to EVERYONE. Seriously, what a great night.
Barely a few blocks from the 3rd street promenade, this place proved a remarkable sunday brunch surprise. World-class eggs benedict done with fresh crab and housemade muffins are genuine stars...

High points: the pizza dough flat bread and the ricotta stuffed zucchini (?) were fun and tasty. My bucatini with veal / beef ragu was luscious and not overbearing. My wife's gnocchi was the best either of us had ever tasted - almost fluffy - and nicely dressed in a porcini saute. The Sicliano pizza - anchovy - was a fine example of thin, crispy wood-fired pizza. Finally, our fourth had the seafood spaghetti special and raved about the variety of sea meats in her sauce. We enjoyed Divino very much and felt welcome to the late end of our evening.
Great food, and deserts.Only thing missing is a good espresso, been there twice and both times the espresso had no crema.

Really enjoyed a tapas style dinner with friends on Saturday night. Attentive staff, great food and drinks.

Matt the server is a gem.

A lady at another table was waving both her arms trying to catch his attention several times unsuccessfully!
Food is great. Beer & Wine selection great. Service is poor in communication, but fixable if the restaurant focuses on it.

Changed their brunch menu for the worse. It's smaller, overly egg-heavy. They removed all the sandwiches, removed most of the pancakes, removed the french toast, and removed many of the good breakfast sides. The portions are also significantly smaller. Our waiter was also clueless about the new menu, hadn't tasted any of the new items, and seemed as annoyed as we were. Very disappointed.
A must try!!! Fabulous drinks and food. A foodie's paradise!!!! Gooooo!!!!!

me and my husband and 2 girls went on the 25th. As usual we had a great time and great food. Our server was WOUNDERFULL. My daughter fell in love with the pizza. I would recomend this place a 100 out of 100.

Some vegetarians do not eat tofu, but we do like to have some protein with our meals. This would also raise the stakes for the nearby Real Food Daily, which only caters to vegans. Monsoon caters to everyone, so adding these foods would be smart..

As others have noted, you are paying to say you had ate at the Polo Lounge at Beverly Hills Hotel, but worth it for a special occasion.

I would recommend reservations especially if you want a table outside.

Our table ordered tangerine chicken, broccoli beef, and walnut shrimp. All were good and on par with other chinese restaurants in the area. We also ordered the shanghai steamed bun appetizer, which is not typically found at other chinese restaurants. They were moist and juicy, by far the favorite dish on our table.

The food was outstanding! Every dish we ordered was amazing and creative and tasty! They said they add 20% automatically for gratuity for groups of 6 and more...our bill showed 30% more! Turned out, when we pointed it out, that "it was for another table" and they quickly fixed it. column8: Beverly / Fairfax / La Brea / Third St.
column13: I'd been hankering for Cochinita Pibil ever since I saw it on the menu some months ago. The Chef's interpretation of this dish, while modern and pared down, doesn't detract from the expected experience of having such a classic dish. The very spicy habanero sauce was an excellent complement. We also liked that the sauces and tortillas come on the side. For those of us who are on low carb regimens, it is a bonus.

column1: Red Room Food and Wine Bar
column13: My boyfriend and I went to Red Room for our second time and loved it all over again. Great tapas, wines, and ambiance for a small, intimate venue. We're definitely going back for another romantic date.

I'm in Hermosa but make the drive because the food is predominantly organic and delicious. My favorites are the Kobe style meat loaf, sometimes made with lamb, the garlic-parsley calamari, sauteed sweetbreads, but I've had everything on the menu and nothing has disappointed me. It's easy to get in during the week and sometimes on the weekends. I can usually find a space on the street too, which on Sawtelle is not always easy. It is such a terrific place for non-traditional Japanese influenced haute cuisine, it's no wonder that my Bacchus brethren are regulars there.

To that off with a Sean Combs sighting on the way out, and it was a great evening at $75 pp!
